page.title: 01Details of Disc
page.content: {The township of Spennymoor and the {villages of Tudhoe and Croxdale {present and interesting and varied {face to the world which we will try to {portray here. In order to provide a view of life in the Spennymoor area we have begun with a general description of the area (pages 2 to 7). There then follows a 2 page report on a survey given to 11 and 15 year old children (pages 8 and 9). A description of a local farm is given on pages 10 and 11. An interview with an elderly resident who knows the area well is reported next (pages 12 and 13). On pages 14 and 15 is found a school-girl's diary. This is followed by a child's view of the future (page 16). Pages 17 to 19 comprise a visitor's guide to the area. On page 20 is a little story of how the Nicky-Nack got its name.
